text.content:
Pt. is a 55 year old FEMALE, veteran admitted on 11/18/11@12:00
 
CHIEF COMPLAINT: Fever of 101-102 at home, generalize weakness, exhaustion.
 
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Came to the ER this morning, cxr reveals Pnuemonia
 
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY:
Diabetes mellitus type 2
Hypertension
Osteopenia
Postoperative hypothyroidism
Depression
Hyperlipidemia

 
PAST SURGICAL HISTORY:
Thyroidectomy (complete, bilateral): 2002
 

           M E D I C A T I O N    R E C O N C I L I A T I O N : 
           ---------------------------------------------------- 

WARNING: Connection to Remote Data Currently Down

MEDICATION RECONCILIATION

WARNING: Connection to Remote Data Currently Down
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
------
Alphabetized list of outpatient Rx's, inpatient orders, remote and Non-VA
meds
Legend: OPT = VA issued outpatient prescription, INP = VA issued inpatient
order
Non-VA Meds Last Documented On: Aug 04, 2011
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
------
Computer is the source for the following medication list:


ASPIRIN 81MG EC TAB                  Sig: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY

CALCIUM CARBONATE 1.25GM (CA 500MG)  Sig: TAKE 500MG TABLET(S) BY MOUTH EVERY 8 
HOURS

CHLORTHALIDONE 25MG TAB              Sig: TAKE ONE-HALF TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY 
DAY

GLYBURIDE 2.5MG TAB                  Sig: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY

LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) 0.125M  Sig: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY

LISINOPRIL 20MG TAB                  Sig: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY

SIMVASTATIN 80MG TAB                 Sig: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY

VENLAFAXINE HCL 75MG SA CAP          Sig: TAKE ONE CAPSULE BY MOUTH TWICE A DAY

ERGOCALCIFEROL 1000 UNIT CAP         Sig: TAKE 1000 UNITS BY MOUTH EVERY DAY

ASPIRIN 81MG EC TAB                  Sig: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH QD

CALCIUM CARBONATE 1.25GM (CA 500MG)  Sig: TAKE 500 MG BY MOUTH THREE TIMES A DAY

CHLORTHALIDONE 25MG TAB              Sig: TAKE 12.5 MG  BY MOUTH DAILY

ERGOCALCIFEROL 1000 UNIT CAP         Sig: TAKE 1000 UNITS BY MOUTH DAILY

GLYBURIDE 2.5MG TAB                  Sig: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY

LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) 0.125M  Sig: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH DAILY

LISINOPRIL 20MG TAB                  Sig: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH DAILY

SIMVASTATIN 80MG TAB                 Sig: TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY EVENING

VENLAFAXINE HCL 37.5MG TAB           Sig: TAKE TWO TABLETS BY MOUTH TWICE A DAY


--------------------------------------------------------------------------
------
Other medications previously dispensed in the last year:
  The medication list above was reviewed with the patient (or patient
  representative) at today's visit. I have indicated discrepancies under
  each medication that is not being taken as prescribed. Medication
  orders, including any additions or discontinuations, have been updated
  as appropriate, and the patient now has an accurate medication list.
 
Current LISTED Allergies: 
METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE
 
  SOCIAL HISTORY: 
    Living Situation: Divorced, lives with 2 kids at home.

  Tobacco use: Quit approx 2002
    Tobacco products patient uses:
      Cigarettes 1/2 p/day x 20 years

  ETOH:
    Yes, but rarely

  Drugs:
    No.
  Marital Status: Divorced
 
FAMILY HISTORY:
 Diabetes mellitus type 2 and osteoporosis in the patients mother.


REVIEW OF SYSTEMS:
  GENERAL: fever, chills x 48 hours, denies recent weight gain
  SKIN: no rashes
  HEENT: no vision changes, no stiff neck
  CARDIAC: denies chest pain
  PULMONARY: + SOB/DOE, no cough
  GI: no n/v, no d/c
  GU: no dysuria
  EXTREMITY/MUSCULOSKELETAL: +++ swelling
  NEUROLOGIC: no weakness

 WANDERING RISK ASSESSMENT (VA Directive 2010-052)
     Patient is NOT cognitively impaired.
 
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION:
     Vital Signs (most recent): see nursing note for most recent vital signs
 
LABS: (*)
EKG: done in ER, NSR
CXR: done in ER, pnuemonia per ER MD.
 
ASSESSMENT and PLAN:  ABX.  Wean to RA.  CBC, chest XR in am.    D/C to home 
tomorrow if improved.
 
 
EXPECTED LENGTH OF STAY is 2 days.
 
The supervising attending physician responsible for this patient is
Dr. provider.
text.author: RESIDENT,ONE
